  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours

    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Good afternoon. I hope you had a wonderful weekend. This
  is Russ Mitchell in for Katie Couric. 
 
Tonight, we’ll have an astonishing exclusive story
  of a rescue by U.S. troops
  in Baghdad
  last week. Our chief foreign correspondent Lara Logan is with the Army unit that
  made the horrific discovery and then executed a dramatic rescue. She’ll
  have the full story tonight.
 
And Elizabeth Palmer will report on the arrest of
  more than 700 people in 35 countries – it was a global crackdown on pedophiles.
  We’ll tell you how it was done.
 
Turning to domestic news, in Texas flash flooding has stranded numerous
  families on rooftops and left two dead, including one 4-year-old girl who was
  swept away from her mother’s arms by the floodwater. Mark Strassmann
  will survey the massive rescue effort.
 
What’s the most technologically advanced
  aircraft ever built? It’s got wider seats, bigger windows and a shell
  of carbon composite. Call it the “Dreamliner.” Tonight, Nancy
  Cordes will give you a look.
 
Finally, if you don’t know a man named Hasan
  Elahi, you probably wouldn’t care to know where he is at any given
  moment of the day. But the U.S.
  government does want to know –
  and so Hasan’s taken his own initiative to show big brother every move
  he makes.
 
I hope you’ll join us for tonight’s
  broadcast.
 




Russ Mitchell
